org.rnorth.ducttape.circuitbreakers

Class BreakerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rnorth.ducttape.circuitbreakers.BreakerBuilder

  • public class BreakerBuilder
extends Object
    BreakerBuilder A builder of Breaker instances having any combination of the following features:
    • automatic reset after a configured period of time has passed since the last failure
    • configurable state storage, for example for use with a distributed map implementation
    These features are optional; by default instances will be created with none of them.
    Author:
    richardnorth

                                 org.rnorth.ducttape.circuitbreakers.TimeSource timeSource)

      • autoResetAfter

        public BreakerBuilder autoResetAfter(long autoResetInterval,
                                     @NotNull
                                     TimeUnit autoResetUnit)
        Configure the breaker to automatically reset a given time after a failure has occurred. Use this for unattended retry behaviour. If this method is not used, the default is for the breaker to wait `Long.MAX_VALUE` days before it resets automatically, i.e. effectively forever.
        Parameters:
        autoResetInterval - the interval length
        autoResetUnit - the units of the interval
        Returns:
        this

      • storeStateIn

        public BreakerBuilder storeStateIn(@NotNull
                                   ConcurrentMap<String,Object> map,
                                   @NotNull
                                   String keyPrefix)
        Configure the breaker to use the provided Map to store its state. The 
        keyPrefix
        is used to uniquely identify the breaker's entries in the map. 
        keyPrefix
        should be unique; behaviour is undefined if it is not. Additionally, behaviour is undefined if entries are directly modified.
        Parameters:
        map - the map to use for storage
        keyPrefix - a unique prefix for the +Breaker+'s entries in the map
        Returns:
        this

      • storeStateIn

        public BreakerBuilder storeStateIn(@NotNull
                                   StateStore stateStore)
        Configure the breaker to use the provided StateStore to store its state.
        Parameters:
        stateStore - an instance of StateStore to store state in
        Returns:
        this
